1.label: Remember device state
1.description:
This parameter determines how the device will react in the event of power supply failure (e.g. power outage). The parameter is not relevant for outputs set to pulse mode (parameter 150/151 set to 2).
		0 - remains switched off after restoring power
		1 - restores remembered state after restoring power

2.label: First channel – overload safety switch
2.description:
This function allows to turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device can be turned back on via button or sending a control frame.
		0 - Function disabled
		10-36200 - (1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – Power threshold

3.label: Second channel – overload safety switch
3.description:
This function allows to turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device can be turned back on via button or sending a control frame.
		0 - Function disabled
		10-36200 - (1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – Power threshold

10.label: LED frame – power limit
10.description:
This parameter determines maximum active power. Exceeding it results in the LED frame flashing violet. Function is active only when parameter 11 is set to 8 or 9.
		(50.0-3000.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

11.label: LED frame – colour when ON
11.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when thedevice is ON. When set to 8 or 9, LED frame colour will change depending on he measured power and parameter 10. Other colours are set permanently and do not depend on power consumption.

options.label: Colour changes smoothly depending on measured power
Colour changes in steps depending on measured power

12.label: LED frame – colour when OFF
12.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when thedevice is ON. When set to 8 or 9, LED frame colour will change depending on he measured power and parameter 10. Other colours are set permanently and do not depend on power consumption.

13.label: LED frame – brightness
13.description:
This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.
		0 - LED disabled
		1-100 - (1-100% brightness)
		101 - brightness directly proportional to measured power
		102 - brightness inversely proportional asured powerto me

20.label: Buttons operation
20.description: This parameter defines how device buttons should control the channels.

options.label: 1st button turns both channels ON, 2nd button turns both channels OFF
1st button toggles 1st channel, 2nd button toggles 2nd channel
1st button single click turns 1st channel ON, 1st button double click turns 2nd channel ON, 2nd button single click turns both channels OFF

24.label: Buttons orientation
24.description: This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.

options.label: Default (1st button controls 1st channel, 2nd button controls 2nd channel)
Reversed (1st button controls 2nd channel, 2nd button controls 1st channel)

25.label: Outputs orientation
25.description: This parameter allows reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2 without changing the wiring (e.g. in case of invalid connection). Changing orientation turns both outputs off.

30.label: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
30.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

31.label: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
31.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

32.label: Alarm configuration - 3rd slot
32.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

33.label: Alarm configuration - 4th slot
33.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

34.label: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
34.description:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
1B:  [MSB] Notification Type, 2B:  Notification Status, 3B: Event/State Parameters, 4B: [LSB] action
0xX0: no action on output, 0xX1: turn ON, 0xX2: turn OFF, 0xX3: turn ON/OFF continuously, 0x0X: no action on LED frame, 0x1X: LED frame blinks red, 0x2X: LED frame blinks green, 0x4X: LED frame blinks blue, 0x8X: disable LED frame, 0xFX: LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

35.label: Alarm configuration – duration
35.description:
This parameter defines duration of alarm sequence.  When time set in this parameter elapses, alarm is cancelled, LED frame and relay restore normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.
		0 - Infinite
		1-32400 - (1s-9h, 1s step) – Duration

40.label: First button – scenes sent
40.description:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
				1 - Key pressed 1 time
				2 - Key pressed 2 time
				4 - Key pressed 3 time
				8 - Key hold down and key released

41.label: Second button – scenes sent
41.description:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
		1 - Key pressed 1 time
		2 - Key pressed 2 time
		4 - Key pressed 3 time
		8 - Key hold down and key released

60.label: Power reports – include self-consumption
60.description: This parameter determines whether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself.

61.label: Power reports for first channel – on change
61.description:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.
		0 - Reporting on change disabled
		1-500 - (1-500%, 1% step) – Minimal change

62.label: Power reports for first channel – periodic
62.description:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 61).
		0 - periodic reports disabled
		30-32400 - (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

63.label: Power reports for second channel – on change
63.description:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.
		0 - Reporting on change disabled
		1-500 - (1-500%, 1% step) – Minimal change

64.label: Power reports for second channel – periodic
64.description:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 63).
		0 - periodic reports disabled
		30-32400 - (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

65.label: Energy reports for first channel – on change
65.description:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that results in sending new report.
		0 - reporting on change disabled
		1-500 - (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change

66.label: Energy reports for first channel – periodic
66.description:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 66).
		0 - periodic reports disabled
		30-32400 - (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

67.label: Energy reports for second channel – on change
67.description:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that results in sending new report.
		0 - reporting on change disabled
		1-500 - (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change

68.label: Energy reports for second channel – periodic
68.description:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 67).
		0 - periodic reports disabled
		30-32400 - (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

150.label: First channel – operating mode
150.description: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel.

151.label: Second channel – operating mode
151.description: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 2nd channel.

152.label: First channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes
152.description: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the button for 1st channel. The parameter is relevant only for button toggles modes (parameter 20 set to 1 or 3).

options.label: Cancel mode and set default state
No reaction - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

153.label: Second channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes
153.description: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the button for 2nd channel. The parameter is relevant only for button toggles modes (parameter 20 set to 1 or 3).

options.label: Cancel mode and set default state
No reaction - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

154.label: First channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes
154.description:
This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes for 1st channel (parameter 150). Delay time for switching off or duration of the pulse.
		0 - 0.1 second
		1-32000 - 1-32000s, 1s step – time parameter

155.label: Second channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes
155.description:
This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes for 2nd channel (parameter 151). Delay time for switching off or duration of the pulse.
		0 - 0.1 second
		1-32000 - 1-32000s, 1s step – time parameter

156.label: First channel – Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
156.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group for manual changes of Endpoint 1 state.
		0-99 - 2nd association group
		255 - 3rd association group

157.label: First channel – Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
157.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group for manual changes of Endpoint 1 state.
		0-99 - 2nd association group
		255 - 3rd association group

158.label: First channel – Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
158.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group for manual changes of Endpoint 1 state.
		0-99 - 2nd association group
		255 - 3rd association group

159.label: Second channel – Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
159.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices associated in 4th and  5th association group for manual changes of Endpoint 2 state.
		0-99 - 4th association group
		255 - 5th association group

160.label: Second channel – Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
160.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group for manual changes of Endpoint 2 state.
		0-99 - 4th association group
		255 - 5th association group

161.label: Second channel – Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
161.description:
This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group for manual changes of Endpoint 2 state.
		0-99 - 4th association group
		255 - 5th association group
